msg.msgText: Name Name of the Policy. Description A description of the Policy Destination Message topic, queue or global-shared subscription this policy applies to. DestinationType Destination type. Options: Topic, Queue, and Subscription ActionList Comma-delimited list of allowed actions. Options: Publish,Subscribe,Send,Receive,Browse,Control Publish, and Subscribe options are for Topic. Send, Receive, and Browse options are for Queue. Receive and Control options are for Subscription. MaxMessages The maximum number of messages to keep for a subscription. Options: 1-20000000 Default: 5000 MaxMessagesBehavior The behavior applied when the number of messages in buffer for a subscription reaches the MaxMessages value. Options: RejectNewMessages, DiscardOldMessages Default: RejectNewMessages RejectNewMessages: While the buffer is full, new messages are rejected. DiscardOldMessages: When the buffer is full and a new message arrives, the old un-delivered messages are discarded. This setting can result in some messages not being delivered to subscribers, even if the publisher receives acknowledgment of the delivery. The messages are discarded even if both the publisher and the subscriber requested reliable messaging. MaxMessageTimeToLive The maximum number of seconds that messages that are put or published under the policy can live for. Options: unlimited, 1-2147483647 Default: unlimited The value unlimited sets no maximum. Instead, the value that the publisher specifies is used. DisconnectedClientNotification Specify if a notification message is published for a disconnected client on arrival of a message Options:True,False. Default:False.

msgExplanation.p: This message is the text of a command or an object help.
